timeline.bodyText:
I have to admit, this class is confusing to me. What is an "UploadAccessCondition" and what does it have to do with a ResourcePolicy?  Why do we require a "partial representation" of a ResourcePolicy? Why is this class a DTO, when we tend to create *Rest model objects for the REST API layer?
Also, I'm noticing we already have an org.dspace.app.rest.model.AccessConditionOptionRest object and an org.dspace.app.rest.model.ResourcePolicyRest object.  What is this class doing that couldn't be handled by one of those other existing objects?
(To clarify here, I'm not against adding this DTO if it's needed. But, I'd like us to better describe why it is needed and how it differs from the previously mentioned Rest objects. It's currently not clear to me why we need this object.)

replies.bodyText:
yes, we need an additional class to represent the payload used by the rest client to update information in the upload section of a workspaceitem. I will add more information about it in the javadoc, but the main difference is that the ResourcePolicyRest object contains a reference to the real Group object but here we only need the uuid (the uri-list approach cannot be used inside the patch). The AccessConditionOptionRest instead is used to represent one option to set access in the upload pannel, such as open acces, embargo, leave, etc.
You are of course right about use this new class everywhere in the patch, we will look to fix that
replies.author: abollini

replies.bodyText: Thanks @abollini for the better JavaDocs here, as it's helped me to better wrap my head around how this is working.  I'll now do a more thorough review.

timeline.bodyText:
Based on the changes in this PR, I'm realizing that this PatchOperation class (and all of the ResourcePolicy*PatchOperation classes) is improperly named.
One of the points of confusion I had with this PR was that I initially couldn't understand why "generic" Resource Policy PATCH operations would use a Bitstream-specific DTO.   After digging deeper (thanks to @abollini 's JavaDocs), I'm realizing this PATCH class is not generic (i.e. it's not handling a patch on the /api/authz/resourcepolicies endpoint).  It's specific to patching resource policies of Bitstreams (only).
Could we use this PR as an opportunity to correct the names of these PatchOperation Classes?  They probably should be named:

BitstreamResourcePolicyAddPatchOperation
BitstreamResourcePolicyReplacePatchOperation
BitstreamResourcePolicyRemovePatchOperation
